intro: Oreolirion platyphyllum, commonly known as the flat-leaf oreolirion, is a perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are broad and flat. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens and dry landscapes.
